title: How saving into a pension as soon as you start work could save you £179 a month
text:
Paying into a pension as soon as you start work could mean saving £179 a month later in your career.

Pension saving is often not a priority for young workers who see retirement as a faraway event in the future while everyday expenses and a likely low starting salary mean finances today are tight.

Auto-enrolment means that most people automatically start paying into a retirement pot when they begin work, but contribution levels are low at 8pc on a band of salary. Research by Scottish Widows found that six in 10 people in their 20s are not saving enough for retirement, although this figure has dropped since last year.
